definitions.definition: (especially in the past) a person on a ship who attacks other ships at sea in order to steal from them

examples.text: There were reports that a pirate ship had come looking for treasure in the cove.

definitions.definition: a person who makes illegal copies of books, computer programs, etc., in order to sell them
a person or an organization that broadcasts illegally

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Latin pirata, from Greek peiratēs, from peirein ‘to attempt, attack’ (from peira ‘an attempt’).
